1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the command of God our Savior and Christ Jesus our hope,

2.verse: to Timothy, genuine child in the faith: Grace, mercy, peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.verse: Stay On In Ephesus To Turn Certain “Law-Teachers” From Worthless Talk To Love - Just as I urged you to stay-on in Ephesus while I was proceeding to Macedonia, do so in order that you might command certain ones not to be teaching-different-doctrines,

4.verse: nor paying-attention-to myths and endless genealogies, which cause speculations rather than a stewardship of  God, which is by faith.

5.verse: And the goal of your command is love from a pure heart and good conscience and sincere faith,

6.verse: having departed from which things some turned-aside into worthless-talk—

7.verse: wanting to be Law-teachers, not understanding either the things which they are saying or about what things they are speaking-confidently.

8.verse: The Law Is Useful When It Is Used Properly: To Correct The Ungodly - Now we know that the Law is good if one is using it lawfully,

9.verse: knowing this: that law is not laid-down for a righteous one but for lawless ones and rebellious ones, ungodly ones and sinful ones, unholy ones and profane ones, father-thrashers and mother-thrashers, man-slayers,

10.verse: sexually-immoral ones, homosexuals, slave-traders, liars, perjurers, and if any other thing is contrary to healthy teaching

11.verse: in accordance with the good-news of the glory of the blessed God which I was entrusted.

12.verse: I Thank The Lord Jesus For Showing Mercy To Me And Appointing Me To Serve Him - I have gratitude to Christ Jesus our Lord, the One having strengthened me, because He regarded me trustworthy, having appointed me for service—

13.verse: I formerly being a blasphemous one and a persecutor and violent one! But I was shown-mercy because being ignorant, I acted in unbelief.

14.verse: And the grace of our Lord overflowed, along with the faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.

15.verse: The saying is trustworthy and worthy of full acceptance— that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am foremost.

16.verse: But for this reason I was shown-mercy: in order that in me, the foremost, Christ Jesus might demonstrate all patience, for a pattern for the ones going to put-faith upon Him for eternal life.

17.verse: Now to the King of the ages, to the immortal invisible only God, be honor and glory forever and ever, amen.

18.verse: I Am Giving You This Instruction, My Child, So You Can Fight The Good Fight - I am depositing this instruction with you, my child Timothy, in accordance with the preceding prophecies about you, in order that by them you may fight the good fight,

19.verse: having faith and a good conscience, which having pushed-aside, some suffered-shipwreck with respect to the faith—

20.verse: of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I handed-over to Satan in order that they may be trained not to blaspheme.

1.verse: First, I Urge That Prayers And Thanksgivings Be Made For All People - First of all then, I urge that petitions, prayers, intercessions, thanksgivings be made for all people,

2.verse: for kings and all the ones being in a place of superiority, in order that we may spend a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and dignity.

3.verse: This is good and acceptable in the sight of our Savior God,

4.verse: Who desires all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

5.verse: For Jesus Gave Himself As a Ransom For All - For there is one God, and one mediator of God and people— the man Christ Jesus,

6.verse: the One having given Himself as a ransom for all, the testimony given in His own times

7.verse: for which I was appointed a proclaimer and an apostle (I am telling the truth; I am not lying), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.

8.verse: So I want the men in every place to be praying, lifting-up holy hands without anger and argument.

9.verse: Women’s Appearance And Behavior Should Be Fitting For Ones Professing Godliness - Similarly also, I urge that women be adorning themselves in well-ordered apparel with modesty and sound-mindedness— not in braided hair and gold or pearls or very-expensive clothing,

10.verse: but through good works, which is fitting for women professing godliness.

11.verse: Let a woman be learning in quietness with all submission.

12.verse: And I do not permit a woman to teach nor have-authority-over a man, but to be in quietness.

13.verse: For Adam was formed first, then Eve.

14.verse: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been completely-deceived, has come-to-be in transgression.

15.verse: But she will be saved by The Childbearing, if they continue in faith and love and holiness with sound-mindedness.

1.verse: Overseers Must Be Above Reproach - The saying is trustworthy— if anyone aspires-to the office-of-overseer, he desires a good work.

2.verse: Therefore the overseer must be above-reproach, a man of one woman, sober, sound-minded, respectable, hospitable, skillful-at-teaching,

3.verse: not a drunken one, not a brawler, but kind, non-quarrelsome, not-a-money-lover,

4.verse: leading his own household well, having children in submission, with all dignity

5.verse: ( but if one does not know-how to lead his own household, how will he take-care-of a church of God?),

6.verse: not a new-convert, in order that he may not fall into the judgment of the devil, having become conceited.

7.verse: And he must also have a good testimony from the ones outside, in order that he may not fall into reproach and a snare of the devil.

8.verse: Deacons Must Be Honorable And Tested - Deacons similarly must be honorable, not double-tongued, not paying-attention-to much wine, not fond-of-shameful-gain,

9.verse: holding the mystery of the faith with a clean conscience.

10.verse: And let these also first be tested, then let them be serving, being blameless.

11.verse: Their wives similarly must be honorable, not slanderous, sober, faithful in all things.

12.verse: Let deacons be men of one woman, leading their children and their own households well.

13.verse: For the ones having served well obtain for themselves a good standing and great confidence in their faith in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: I Am Writing So You Will Know How To Conduct Yourself In The Church - I am writing these things to you hoping to come to you quickly,

15.verse: but in-case I am slow, in order that you may know how you ought-to conduct-yourself  in the household of God— which is the church of the living God, the pillar and support of the truth.

16.verse: God Was Revealed In The Flesh, But Some Will Depart From The Faith And Good Teaching - And the mystery of godliness is confessedly great: Who was revealed in the flesh, was declared-righteous in the spirit; was seen by messengers, was proclaimed among the nations; was believed in the world, was taken-up in glory.

1.verse: But the Spirit explicitly says that in later times some will depart from the faith, paying-attention-to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons

2.verse: by means of the hypocrisy of liars having been seared as to their own conscience—

3.verse: forbidding to marry, commanding to abstain from foods which God created for a receiving with thanksgiving by the ones who are believers and know the truth.

4.verse: Because every creature of God is good. And nothing being received with thanksgiving is to be rejected,

5.verse: for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

6.verse: While pointing-out these things to the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, while being nourished in the words of the faith and the good teaching which you have closely-followed.

7.verse: But be declining the profane and old-womanish myths. But You Be Training Yourself For Godliness In Your Character And Teaching -But be training yourself for godliness.

8.verse: For bodily training is profitable for a little, but godliness is profitable for all things— having promise for the present life and the one coming.

9.verse: The saying is trustworthy and worthy of full acceptance.

10.verse: For we are laboring and struggling for this, because we have put our hope upon the living God, Who is the Savior of all people— especially of believers.

11.verse: Be commanding and teaching these things.

12.verse: Let no one be-looking-down-on your youth, but be a pattern for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.

13.verse: Until I come, be paying-attention-to the reading, the exhortation, the teaching.

14.verse: Do not be careless of the gift in you, which was given to you through a prophecy with the laying-on of the hands of the council-of-elders.

15.verse: Be taking-care-with these things, be in these things, in order that your progress may be evident to everyone.

16.verse: Be fixing-your-attention-on yourself and your teaching. Be continuing in them. For while doing this, you will save both yourself and the ones hearing you.

1.verse: Speak To Everyone As You Would Your Own Family Members - Do not sharply-rebuke an older man, but be appealing-to him as a father, younger men as brothers,

2.verse: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters in all purity.

3.verse: Provide Church Support For Real Widows Attested By Faith And Good Works - Be honoring widows— the real widows.

4.verse: Now if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to reverence their own household and to give-back a return to their ancestors. For this is acceptable in the sight of God.

5.verse: But the one who is a real widow and has been left-alone has put her hope upon God, and continues-in petitions and prayers by night and by day.

6.verse: But the one living-indulgently is-dead while living.

7.verse: Indeed be commanding these things in order that they may be above-reproach.

8.verse: But if anyone does not provide-for his own relatives, and especially family-members, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

9.verse: Let a widow be put-on-the-list having become not fewer than sixty years old, a woman of one man,

10.verse: being attested by good works: if she brought-up-children, if she received-strangers, if she washed the feet of saints, if she aided ones being afflicted, if she followed-after every good work.

11.verse: But Decline To Include The Young Widows; Let Them Marry - But be declining younger widows. For when they grow-sensual against Christ, they want to marry—

12.verse: having condemnation [upon themselves] because they set-aside their first pledge.

13.verse: And at the same time also they are learning to be idle, while going-around the houses. And not only idle, but also babblers and busybodies— speaking the things not being proper.

14.verse: Therefore, I want younger widows to marry, to bear-children, to manage-the-house, to give to the one opposing no opportunity for the sake of reviling.

15.verse: For some already turned-aside after Satan.

16.verse: If any believing-woman has widows, let her be aiding them, and let the church not be burdened in order that it may aid the real widows.

17.verse: Give Unbiased Church Support And Respect To Elders Leading Well - Let the elders having led well be considered-worthy of double honor, especially the ones laboring in word and teaching.

18.verse: For the Scripture says “You shall not muzzle a threshing ox” [Deut 25:4], and “The worker is worthy of his wages” [Lk 10:7].

19.verse: Do not be accepting an accusation against an elder unless on the basis of two or three witnesses.

20.verse: Be rebuking the ones sinning in the presence of all, in order that the rest also may have fear.

21.verse: I solemnly-charge you in the sight of God and Christ Jesus and the chosen angels that you keep these things without pre-judgment, doing nothing according-to partiality.

22.verse: Be laying hands on no one hastily, nor sharing in the sins belonging-to-others; be keeping yourself pure.

23.verse: ( No longer be-a-water-drinker, but be using a little wine for the sake of your stomach and your frequent sicknesses).

24.verse: The sins of some people are clear-beforehand, going ahead-of them to judgment, but indeed for some they follow-after.

25.verse: Similarly also the good works are clear-beforehand, and the ones having it otherwise are not able to be hidden.

1.verse: Slaves Are To Honor Their Masters - Let all-who are under a yoke as slaves be regarding their own masters as worthy of all honor, in order that the name of God and the teaching may not be blasphemed.

2.verse: And let the ones having believing masters not be disregarding them because they are brothers, but let them be serving them more, because the ones being helped by the good-work are believers and beloved ones. Anyone Who Teaches Differently Is Spiritually Diseased And Pursuing Personal Gain - Be teaching and exhorting these things.

3.verse: If anyone teaches-different-doctrines, and does not come-to healthy words— the ones of our Lord Jesus Christ— and to the teaching in accordance with godliness,

4.verse: he has become conceited, understanding nothing, but being diseased with respect to controversies and word-battles, out of which comes envy, strife, blasphemies, evil suspicions,

5.verse: constant-frictions, from people having been corrupted as to the mind and robbed of the truth, while supposing that godliness is a means-of-gain.

6.verse: Now godliness with contentment is a means of great gain.

7.verse: For we brought-in nothing to the world; it is clear that neither can we bring-out anything.

8.verse: But having sustenance and coverings, with these things we shall be content.

9.verse: But the ones wanting to be-rich fall into temptation and a snare, and many foolish and harmful desires which plunge people into ruin and destruction.

10.verse: For the love-of-money is a root of all evils— aspiring-to which, some were led-astray from the faith and pierced themselves with many pains.

11.verse: But You, O Man of God, Fight The Good Fight And Keep The Command Unspotted - But you, O man of God, be fleeing these things, and be pursuing righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance, gentleness.

12.verse: Be fighting the good fight of faith. Take-hold-of eternal life, into which you were called, and confessed the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.

13.verse: I command you in the sight of God, the One giving-life-to all things, and Christ Jesus, the One having testified the good confession before Pontius Pilate,

14.verse: that you keep the commandment unspotted, above-reproach, until the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.verse: which in His own times, the blessed and only Ruler will show— the King of the ones being-kings and Lord of the ones being-lords,

16.verse: the only One having immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light, Whom none of mankind saw nor is able to see, to Whom be honor and eternal dominion, amen.

17.verse: Command The Rich To Be Rich In Good Works And To Take Hold of Real Life - Be commanding the ones rich in the present age not to be-high-minded, nor to have put-hope on the uncertainty of riches, but upon God, the One richly granting us all things for enjoyment;

18.verse: to be working-good, to be-rich in good works, to be generous, sharing ones,

19.verse: treasuring-up for themselves a good foundation for the future, in order that they may take-hold-of real life.

20.verse: Guard The Deposit, Timothy - O Timothy, guard the deposit, turning-aside-from the profane empty-chatterings and opposing-arguments of the falsely-named “knowledge”—

21.verse: professing which, some missed-the-mark with respect to the faith. Grace be with you all.
